page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: Brampton is a small market town with about 4,000 inhabetants.It lies in the valley of the River Irthing 9 miles north-east of Carlisle.It is not far from the Scottish border and is only 3 miles south of Hadrian's Wall.Being a 'Border Town',it has a colourful history.It dates back to the 7th century and became a market town in 1252,when it was granted a market charter by King Henry III.It has remained a market town ever since , serving the local rural communities. Pastoral farming (i.e.sheep, beef-cattle, and dairy-cattle)is still the major land use of the area. It is a well-wooded district too, sheltered by the Pennine Fells. Apart from Brampton, settlement consists of scattered farmhouses and the three hamlets of Burtholme, Lanercost and Boothby.
